data.sentence: The word هِيَ comes from the root ه ي and is associated with the meanings: she

data.meanings: to bind tightly, strap, strengthen firmly, run, establish, make firm, hard, strong, be advanced (day), be intense. ushdud - harden, strengthen. shadiid (pl. shidaad & ashidda'u - great, firm, strict, vehement, strong, violent, severe, mighty, terrible, stern, grievous, miserly, niggardly. (adj. of the forms fa'iil and fiaal are used indifferently for both m. and f.): ashuddun: age of full strength, maturity. ishtadda (vb. 8) - to act with violence, become hard.
data.sentence: The word أَشَدُّ comes from the root ش د د and is associated with the meanings: to bind tightly, strap, strengthen firmly, run, establish, make firm, hard, strong, be advanced (day), be intense. ushdud - harden, strengthen. shadiid (pl. shidaad & ashidda'u - great, firm, strict, vehement, strong, violent, severe, mighty, terrible, stern, grievous, miserly, niggardly. (adj. of the forms fa'iil and fiaal are used indifferently for both m. and f.): ashuddun: age of full strength, maturity. ishtadda (vb. 8) - to act with violence, become hard.

data.meanings: night, evening. layl n.m. (f. laylah, pl. layali)
data.sentence: The word اللَّيْلِ comes from the root ل ي ل and is associated with the meanings: night, evening. layl n.m. (f. laylah, pl. layali)

data.meanings: stand still or firm, rose/stand up, managed/conducted/ordered/regulated/superintended, established, made it straight/right, maintain/erect/observe/perform, set up, people/community/company, abode, stature/dignity/rank. aqama - to keep a thing or an affair in a right state.
data.sentence: The word وَأَقْوَمُ comes from the root ق و م and is associated with the meanings: stand still or firm, rose/stand up, managed/conducted/ordered/regulated/superintended, established, made it straight/right, maintain/erect/observe/perform, set up, people/community/company, abode, stature/dignity/rank. aqama - to keep a thing or an affair in a right state.

data.meanings: to say/speak, to call, to be named, word/speech, utterance, a thing said, greeting, discourse, one who says/speaks. To inspire/transmit/relate/answer/think/profess, emit an opinion on, indicate a state or condition or circumstance. qa'ilun - speaker, indicator.
data.sentence: The word قِيلًا comes from the root ق و ل and is associated with the meanings: to say/speak, to call, to be named, word/speech, utterance, a thing said, greeting, discourse, one who says/speaks. To inspire/transmit/relate/answer/think/profess, emit an opinion on, indicate a state or condition or circumstance. qa'ilun - speaker, indicator.

data.meanings: lived, arose, become elevated/high, grow up, create/produce/originate, it happened/occurred, raise, to found/build, began, specifically discussing 73:6 = rising in the night, first part/hours of the night, every hour of the night in which one rises, every hour of the night.
data.sentence: The word نَاشِئَةَ comes from the root ن ش ا and is associated with the meanings: lived, arose, become elevated/high, grow up, create/produce/originate, it happened/occurred, raise, to found/build, began, specifically discussing 73:6 = rising in the night, first part/hours of the night, every hour of the night in which one rises, every hour of the night.

data.meanings: to tread upon, walk on, press the ground or anything beneath the feet, trample on, level, make plam. tawaata'a - to agree with each other respecting the affair.. . Yata'auna (imp. 3rd. p. m. plu.): They tread, step, enter a land, destroy.. Tata'u (imp. 2nd. p. m. plu.): Ye have trodden, entered.. Tata'uu (imp. 2nd. p. m. plu. acc.): That ye may trample on, trodden down.. Wat'an (v. n.): Curbing, Subduing; Treading.. Mauti'an (n. place. acc.): Trodden place.. Yuwaati'uu (III.): Adjust; Make equal; Conform.
data.sentence: The word وَطْئًا comes from the root و ط ا and is associated with the meanings: to tread upon, walk on, press the ground or anything beneath the feet, trample on, level, make plam. tawaata'a - to agree with each other respecting the affair.. . Yata'auna (imp. 3rd. p. m. plu.): They tread, step, enter a land, destroy.. Tata'u (imp. 2nd. p. m. plu.): Ye have trodden, entered.. Tata'uu (imp. 2nd. p. m. plu. acc.): That ye may trample on, trodden down.. Wat'an (v. n.): Curbing, Subduing; Treading.. Mauti'an (n. place. acc.): Trodden place.. Yuwaati'uu (III.): Adjust; Make equal; Conform.
